admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund:
TF022905-EDUCATION PROJECT,TF022620-CANADIAN CTF FOR E. & C.
            EUROPE & THE CIS,TF023059-PHRD-EMPLOYMENT & SOCIAL
            PROTECTION PROJ

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Bulgaria - Social
            Insurance Administration project and the sustainability were
            both highly satisfactory, the institutional development
            impact was high and, the Bank and the borrower performance
            were both highly satisfactory. The lessons learned during
            the project were that successful institutional capacity
            building takes many years and requires a comprehensive array
            of investments, including infrastructure , development of
            management skills and team building, expert skills training,
            basic skill training and, strategic and business planning.
            Project design needs to be developed with the involvement
            and commitment of client, country stakeholders, all donors
            and, subject matter experts. New roles were assigned to the
            National Social Security Institute. Investment in building
            institutional capacity should be the first step when working
            with a country to develop new policies so that the
            institutions are prepared to help develop and then implement
            new policies. Projects that build institutional capacity
            need to be structured and financed to provide ongoing expert
            advice. Projects require strong and active Bank
            participation at supervision and support, along with strong
            commitment by the client management. It is very important
            that all officials responsible for project components, not
            just the project coordination unit, acquire strategic and
            project planning skills for successful project management
            and capacity building.
